docs.snippet: The military-controlled Gov ernment of President Juan M. Bordaberry took firm action to day to try to end the general strike that has paralyzed thiscapital for a week.
docs.lead_paragraph: The military-controlled Gov ernment of President Juan M. Bordaberry took firm action to day to try to end the general strike that has paralyzed thiscapital for a week.

headline.main: Uruguay Regime Takes Firm Measures Against General Strike; Congress Is Closed Food Shortages Reported

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Alex Metreveli defeated Alex Mayer of Wayne, N. J., the dark horse and conqueror of Ilie Nastase, 6-3, 3-6, 6-3, 6-4, in the semifinals of the $132,000 Wimbledon. tennis championship today.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Metreveli defeated Alex Mayer of Wayne, N. J., the dark horse and conqueror of Ilie Nastase, 6-3, 3-6, 6-3, 6-4, in the semifinals of the $132,000 Wimbledon. tennis championship today.
docs.abstract: comment on July 5 men's semi-final events at Wimbledon tennis tourn; A Metreveli and J Kodes advance to final; illus

headline.main: Metreveli Beats Mayer In 4 Sets; Kodes Victor; East europeans to Play in Final at Wimbledon

docs.snippet: Dmitri M. Segal, a Soviet Jewish scholar who fought a long battle with Russian authorities for permission to emigrate, has arrived in Vienna on his way to Israel.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dmitri M. Segal, a Soviet Jewish scholar who fought a long battle with Russian authorities for permission to emigrate, has arrived in Vienna on his way to Israel.
docs.abstract: 6 US Marines identified by Vietnam Vets Against the War as Pvt D Planty, Pfcs B Monfort, E Shepherd, W F Cox, and Lance Cpls P Norman and C D Badmington, are stopped by their superiors on Independence Day (July 4) from distributing what mil authorities consider distorted version of Declaration of Independence, Marine base in Iwanuki, Japan; base spokesman asserts their cases are being investigated and that mil authorities believe that modern-language interpretation of 1st 5 secs of Declaration, in leaflets men distributed, advocated overthrow of Govt

headline.main: World News Briefs; Soviet Emigrants Arrive in Vienna Argentine Pilot Tells of Hijacking New Zealand Ship In A-Test Zone Marines Rewrite The Declaration Uruguayan Slain By Army Patrol

docs.snippet: On 6 o'clock on a recent morning, 10 teen-agers gathered in a small room at the rear of the Brooklyn chapel of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (Mormons).
docs.lead_paragraph: On 6 o'clock on a recent morning, 10 teen-agers gathered in a small room at the rear of the Brooklyn chapel of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (Mormons).
docs.abstract: Article on hour-long hs 'seminary' in religious educ conducted at Mormon chapels in 50 states and 32 foreign countries; sessions are attended by 52,320 young men and women and taught by 4,600 qualified teachers, supervisors and coordinators; seminary program, begun in 1912 in Salt Lake City, is part of extensive educ system for Mormons; through coll-level insts and missionary training for young men and women, serious members of the faith (male only) may advance to function as priests and go up hierarchical ladder to become elders and apostles; students comment on study sessions; illus

docs.snippet: A siren cuts through the rain and the winter air. A blue armored police wagon pulls up at a soap factory and disgorges policemen with ma chine guns. They force their way into the closed plant, round up the workers insideand drive them out.
docs.lead_paragraph: A siren cuts through the rain and the winter air. A blue armored police wagon pulls up at a soap factory and disgorges policemen with ma chine guns. They force their way into the closed plant, round up the workers insideand drive them out.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan gen strike protesting Pres Bordaberry's closing of Cong enters 12th day; factories are cleared by army only to be re-occupied by workers; observers feel that fate of democracy in Uruguay depends on ability of strikers to hold out; 30,000 take part in funeral cortege of R Pere Bardier, who was shot in back on July 6 by mil patrol, which said he fired on them; closing of Cong has led to formation of informal alliance of trade unions, most pol parties, students and such professionals as doctors and journalists; goal of alliance is Bordaberry's ouster and restoration of democracy; even Govt is affected, with resignations of several officials reptd; public is caught in middle of contest between strikers and Govt and its mil backers; hardships are not sufficient at moment to provoke mass protest but there is anxiety about what will happen when continued closing of most of factories is felt; strike of bank workers is most disruptive; money is in short supply and trade has slowed dramatically; effect of strike on public transport, food supply and news media noted; army and police still patrol Montevideo; Govt has ordered all public servants be dismissed if they do not return to work and that strikers in private enterprise can be let go without compensation

headline.main: A Nervous Montevideo Awaits the Outcome as Workers Resist Army Crackdown; Student Is Killed

docs.snippet: The military-backed Gov ernment of President Juan M. Bordaberry vigorously crushed a demonstration today called to protest the abolishment of democratic institutions. Somecasualties were reported.
docs.lead_paragraph: The military-backed Gov ernment of President Juan M. Bordaberry vigorously crushed a demonstration today called to protest the abolishment of democratic institutions. Somecasualties were reported.
docs.abstract: Govt of Pres J M Bordaberry crushes demonstration called on July 9 to protest abolition of democratic institutions; 2 are killed and many injured and arrested after clash in which army and police use sabers, armored cars, clubs and tear gas; tensions increased after previous night's killing of 16-yr-old W Medina Delgado, who was shot while painting anti-Govt slogans on wall; Natl Workers Confederation continues gen strike; Bordaberry seems to becoming more isolated politically; there are numerous resignations from Govt; members of own Colorado party have joined with labor unions and student orgns to form Resistance Front; Front carefully avoids attacks on mil, offering to cooperate with it in program of 'natl reconstruction'; through leaflet campaign, Front expounds program for ending crisis; it wants provisional govt of representative sectors including mil, guarantee of civil liberties and restoration of pol and trade union rights; other demands listed; Roman Catholic and Protestant churches issue statements expressing concern over crisis

headline.main: Troops in Montevideo Crush a Protest; Military Dissidents Wooed

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: John W. G. Powell, a retired investment counselor and the husband of Dr. Janet Travell, who was White House physician to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, died Monday of cancer in George Washington University Hospital. He was 75 years old.
docs.lead_paragraph: John W. G. Powell, a retired investment counselor and the husband of Dr. Janet Travell, who was White House physician to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, died Monday of cancer in George Washington University Hospital. He was 75 years old.

headline.main: JOHN W. G. POWELL, 75, INVESTMENT ADVISER

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: John N. Mitchell swore to the Senate Watergate committee that he had deliberately withheld information from President Nixon about the 1972 campaign conspiracy and "White House horror stories" to prevent damage to the President's bid for re-election....
docs.lead_paragraph: John N. Mitchell swore to the Senate Watergate committee that he had deliberately withheld information from President Nixon about the 1972 campaign conspiracy and "White House horror stories" to prevent damage to the President's bid for re-election. He persistently denied that he had authorized the political intelligence gathering scheme that led to the Watergate break-in. [Page 1, Column 8.]
docs.abstract: correction on July 9 story on NZ frigate Otago; ship will not sail in French territorial waters off Mururoa atoll; is sailing in internatl waters only

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day Watergate Investigation National Metropolitan International CORRECTION Quotation of the Day The Other News

docs.snippet: The military-backed Government and the opposition have hardened their positions, confronting Uruguay with her worst political crisis in decades.
docs.lead_paragraph: The military-backed Government and the opposition have hardened their positions, confronting Uruguay with her worst political crisis in decades.
docs.abstract: Govt arrests: L Seregni, head of Resistance Front; H Murdoch, pres of Natl party; J P Cardozo, leader of Socialist party; Gen V Licandro and Col C Zufriategui of Broad Front; 6 member of dissolved Cong also arrested; officials also rept 300 arrested in July 9 demonstration in Montevideo; independent comm is set up to reach truce between Front and Govt

headline.main: Regime Arrests Foes as Uruguay's Crisis Intensifies; Two Reported Killed

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The powerful Communistdominated National Workers Confederation called off a general strike tonight, urging workers to go back on the job tomorrow in what was considered a major step toward a solution of the political crisis that has paralyzed the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The powerful Communistdominated National Workers Confederation called off a general strike tonight, urging workers to go back on the job tomorrow in what was considered a major step toward a solution of the political crisis that has paralyzed the life of this country for the last two weeks.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Natl Workers Confederation on July 11 calls off gen strike called to protest Pres J M Bordaberry's dosing of Cong; action is considered victory for his mil-backed Govt; strike leaders say they have made no deals with Govt; mil comdrs issue communique stating support for civilian govt; say they will follow course of ideological independence and adhere to program of 'national reconstruction, announced last Feb; leftists hail their position; Bordaberry swears in 4 new Cabinets members, replacing those who resigned in protest; 4 are: E Narancio, Educ and Culture; J Etcheverry Stirling, Indus and Commerce; E Crispo Ayala, Public Works; Dr J Bruno Iruleguy, Public Health; Bordaberry says he will rule by decree; Council of State, composed of 'notables' named by Pres, will be set up as check to him

headline.main: URUGUAYAN UNION CALLS OFF STRIKE; Action Called a Major Step Toward Ending Crisis Forces Affirm Civil Rule

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWESpecial to The New York Times
